data.name: current-pokedex-landing_label
data.value: You are on the Pokedex of generation

data.name: have-to-be-connected_warning
data.value: You have to be logged in to access this page.

data.name: no-game-in-collection_warning
data.value: Oops ! You don't have any game yet.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-1-description-label
data.value: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-2-description-label
data.value: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-3-description-label
data.value: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-4-description-label
data.value: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-5-description-label
data.value: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-6-description-label
data.value: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-7-description-label
data.value: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-8-description-label
data.value: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-9-description-label
data.value: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-10-description-label
data.value: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-11-description-label
data.value: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-12-description-label
data.value: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-13-description-label
data.value: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-14-description-label
data.value: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-15-description-label
data.value: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-16-description-label
data.value: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-17-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-18-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-19-description-label
data.value: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-20-description-label
data.value: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-21-description-label
data.value: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-22-description-label
data.value: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-23-description-label
data.value: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-24-description-label
data.value: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-25-description-label
data.value: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-26-description-label
data.value: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-27-description-label
data.value: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-28-description-label
data.value: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-29-description-label
data.value: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-30-description-label
data.value: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-31-description-label
data.value: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-32-description-label
data.value: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-33-description-label
data.value: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-34-description-label
data.value: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-35-description-label
data.value: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-36-description-label
data.value: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-37-description-label
data.value: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-38-description-label
data.value: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-39-description-label
data.value: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-40-description-label
data.value: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-41-description-label
data.value: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-42-description-label
data.value: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-43-description-label
data.value: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-44-description-label
data.value: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-45-description-label
data.value: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-46-description-label
data.value: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-47-description-label
data.value: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-48-description-label
data.value: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-49-description-label
data.value: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-50-description-label
data.value: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-51-description-label
data.value: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-52-description-label
data.value: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-53-description-label
data.value: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-54-description-label
data.value: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-55-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-56-description-label
data.value: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-57-description-label
data.value: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-58-description-label
data.value: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-59-description-label
data.value: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-60-description-label
data.value: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-61-description-label
data.value: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-62-description-label
data.value: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-63-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-64-description-label
data.value: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-65-description-label
data.value: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-66-description-label
data.value: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-67-description-label
data.value: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-68-description-label
data.value: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-69-description-label
data.value: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-70-description-label
data.value: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-71-description-label
data.value: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-72-description-label
data.value: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-73-description-label
data.value: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-74-description-label
data.value: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-75-description-label
data.value: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-76-description-label
data.value: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-77-description-label
data.value: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-78-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-79-description-label
data.value: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-80-description-label
data.value: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-81-description-label
data.value: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-82-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-83-description-label
data.value: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-84-description-label
data.value: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-85-description-label
data.value: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-86-description-label
data.value: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-87-description-label
data.value: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-88-description-label
data.value: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-89-description-label
data.value: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-90-description-label
data.value: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-91-description-label
data.value: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-92-description-label
data.value: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-93-description-label
data.value: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-94-description-label
data.value: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-95-description-label
data.value: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-96-description-label
data.value: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-97-description-label
data.value: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-98-description-label
data.value: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-99-description-label
data.value: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-100-description-label
data.value: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-101-description-label
data.value: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-102-description-label
data.value: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-103-description-label
data.value: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-104-description-label
data.value: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-105-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-106-description-label
data.value: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-107-description-label
data.value: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-108-description-label
data.value: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-109-description-label
data.value: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-110-description-label
data.value: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-111-description-label
data.value: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-112-description-label
data.value: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-113-description-label
data.value: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-114-description-label
data.value: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-115-description-label
data.value: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-116-description-label
data.value: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-117-description-label
data.value: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-118-description-label
data.value: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-119-description-label
data.value: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-120-description-label
data.value: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-121-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-122-description-label
data.value: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-123-description-label
data.value: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-124-description-label
data.value: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-125-description-label
data.value: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-126-description-label
data.value: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-127-description-label
data.value: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-128-description-label
data.value: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-129-description-label
data.value: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-130-description-label
data.value: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-131-description-label
data.value: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-132-description-label
data.value: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-133-description-label
data.value: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-134-description-label
data.value: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-135-description-label
data.value: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-136-description-label
data.value: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-137-description-label
data.value: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-138-description-label
data.value: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-139-description-label
data.value: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-140-description-label
data.value: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-141-description-label
data.value: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-142-description-label
data.value: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-143-description-label
data.value: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-144-description-label
data.value: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-145-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-146-description-label
data.value: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-147-description-label
data.value: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-148-description-label
data.value: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-149-description-label
data.value: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-150-description-label
data.value: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

data.name: gen-1-pokemon-151-description-label
data.value: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
